item.description:
Do you remember your old 45's and albums?  They have been given new life in a new exhibit at the ICA.  The ICA is a small museum with and unusual and eclectic collection.  Free admission is offered on Thursday evenings.

http://www.icaboston.org/custom-html/index?item_id=19199001

 

We'll first gather at the ICA to check out this and other exhibits, then we can walk down to the new branch of Legal Seafoods Harborside.

http://www.legalseafoods.com/restaurants/boston-legal-harborside

This particular site is set up as two habor-view two levels, the first being casual, the second being a little more formal.  We will enjoy each other's company on the first level.  It is interesting to note that the Level 1 menu inclues some dishes which harken back to Legal's humble beginnings in Inman Square.

http://www.legalseafoods.com/restaurants/boston-legal-harborside-floor-1

group.name: Boston Baby Boomers Meetup Group-Social Fun

item.name: The Art of Vinyl(records, that is)at the ICA and Legal Seafoods Harborside
